# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    wrapped_text = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " $word") > text_width
            wrapped_text *= "$line\n"
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " $word"
    end
    wrapped_text *= "$line" # append the last line
    return wrapped_text
end
```

You can call this function with a string and an optional `text_width` parameter like so:

```julia
print(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet", text_width = 15))
```

This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit amet
```
